column3: Iron bangle worn by Sikhs, which represents the creator is infinite/limitless and also stops bad deeds.
Sikh symbol of power and freedom of spirit, and a reminder to fight injustice and oppression.
Cotton shorts worn by Sikhs as a symbol of pure and righteous character.
Keertan, the melodious way of singing Gurbani (the praises of the Almighty God)
Gurudwara, Sikh Holy place of Worship

Uncut hair (the first of the 5 K’s in Sikhism) which symbolizes the adoption of a simple life and denial of pride in one’s appearance. It is believed that the long hair is a sign of a Sikh’s commitment and devotion to his/her Guru.
Wooden Comb, which symbolizes cleanliness and the importance of discipline.
Beyond Death, Holy Nectar taken by Sikh’s when they get Amritpaan (baptised)
